website_summaries.verdict: Choose these if you want to add them to existing curtains to block light and noise; otherwise competitors have the same qualities built into the design.
pros: Versatile liners that fit most curtains – a bit longer and wider for a perfect match, and available in several sizes
cons: A bit pricey, considering they are just liners and you have to purchase curtains separately
They don't have grommets, and are a bit difficult to hang

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate width description
customer_reviews.text: The description is inaccurate and I'm annoyed about that. It says pair of 54x96 panels. A pair means two. There are two panels, however, they are a COMBINED width of 54", not two 54" panels as the description seems to suggest. I would not have purchased these if it were clear that it was only 27" wide per panel.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: very effective! See pics
customer_reviews.text: Ever effective! I will post the pictures I took after I had put the lining on one side compared to the other, it's like night at day! (Literally!) the panels are smaller than my actual curtains but I just lined them up to go with the inside of each curtain and they cover the window just fine! The first pic is with the light off, look how dark it makes it! and my curtains are white/ivory
customer_reviews.author: Jenkins Family

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: They definitely block out the light, but the loops that you use to attach the panels to the included hooks unravel, and now each of my panels (I got 4) is hanging by just one or two loops. Sure, I can stitch them back on, or better yet sew new loops on. But I have only had these panels a couple of months, and who wants to do that after only a couple of months of use? So, yes they block out the light, but what good is their ability to block light when they have fallen off their hooks and lie crumpled on the floor?
customer_reviews.author: LMCO

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money! These took forever to attach to my curtains, and they do darken the room, but they're destroying the curtains. Little by little, the hooks are tearing holes and now there's a gap at the top letting light in, plus my curtains are ruined. It would have taken just as long to sew the panels on with a sewing machine, and then maybe they wouldn't be torn. Plus two panels only covered one half of the window. As a temporary fix, I covered the other side with a cheap blackout curtain from Walmart. Now I wish I'd done that on both sides; it cost under $10 and worked better than these panels without damaging anything.
customer_reviews.author: bibliophile22Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good light blocking curtain liner
customer_reviews.text: I put these up in my daughter's room using a tension rod behind her regular curtains. They block a good amount of light, which helps for little kids' bedtimes when it's still light outside in the summer. They came with hooks to attach to the existing curtains, too. I like that they are the shorter length (length of the window itself) - they block more light because they fit the window more accurately. I tuck them around the side of the mini blinds to help keep them in place since they're a bit rigid. I imagine they'll wear in a bit and fall more smoothly as time goes on. There was no strange smell to them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: 25x80 In a 54x80 bag?
customer_reviews.text: I’m really confused why these got such good reviews. The curtains are the not the dimensions that are indicated. I, at first, thought they sent me the wrong size by mistake but when the replacement pair came they were the same size. These are no where close to the same size as my existing panels (which are 54x80). I’m confused on how these can block light unless you put two blackout panels on one curtain panel? But then you have a crack of light in the middle and you’ve spent more than just replacing the existing curtains with new blackout curtains...idk. These are going back :-p
customer_reviews.author: binks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I bought white velvet curtains for my bedroom assuming that since they're velvet, they would surely be thick enough to block light. I was wrong but I had already fallen in love with my new curtains and their pretty little pinch pleats 💗 when I found these curtain liners that could just be clipped onto the back of existing curtains, i was ECSTATIC! They were easy to install & made a HUGE difference. In the pictures I'm attaching, one side has a liner & one side doesn't. These were a total game changer for us as it meant we could have pretty curtains AND a dark bedroom. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: I am a little disappointed with these
customer_reviews.text: The description says 54in by 60in. When I received them they are 28in by 60in. I ordered 2 so I could have 4 panels to cover 2 windows. Two of the liners had a tear/cut on them. I am a little disappointed with these, but I was able come up with a plan to get these to work.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Slept like the dead
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding results. Super easy to loop fine secure thread over the drapery hooks I used to attach these liners to my vintage drapes in my camper. Took literally one minute and you can see the dramatic and immediate result! I ordered a second set to finish the job! Absolute life saver. Only issue is they are quite long and will need to be taken up and seen into the back of the draperies but I anticipated the size discrepancy. [photo taken in blistering broad sunlight at 3 pm on a Texas day of 105 heat!]
customer_reviews.author: MavenofMayhem

customer_reviews.title: These liners stink when they got hot.
customer_reviews.text: These liners, when they get warm/hot, start to smell like wet dog and the smell permeates my whole bedroom (incidentally, I have no pets to be creating the odor). I have exchanged them for new sets, and have tried to wash them and use Febreze on them with no success- the new ones within one week of hanging in front of the hot patio door windows start to smell. I can't help but think that it is because these are made in China and they are putting some sort of chemical in them that leaches out after being exposed to heat. They are advertised as being 100% polyester, but there must be formaldehyde or something in them too. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Scott or not

customer_reviews.title: Read reviews to know what your getting!
customer_reviews.text: I was thankful for past reviews that stated these weren’t as wide as they say, but with that being said I bought them anyway and just sewed the two panels together. I also sewed them to the top of my curtains as other reviews said they didn’t stay on the loops very well. I feel they are excellent blackout curtains! And with a little sewing know how I would recommend these to others!
customer_reviews.author: Redleaf

customer_reviews.title: Blocks light great but falls off hooks a lot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my nursery. They do a really good job of blocking out light but I don't really like the design of how they attach to the curtains. The drapes constantly fall off of the hooks every time I open and close the curtains so I'm always having to fix them. If the design to hold them onto the curtain was better it would be five stars no questions!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Liners keep falling off hooks
customer_reviews.text: You have to puncture/damage the curtain with the hooks in order to hang the liner if your curtains have metal loops like mine. They block the light well though. They’re also very narrow so you’ll need to order two sets. Few weeks later - I am returning these because the curtain liners keep falling off the metal hooks every time I open and close my curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make your pretty curtains blackout curtains.
customer_reviews.text: Love them. At first I didn’t realize they DO COME with the hooks to attach them. Also they are narrower on purpose so when the curtain is closed and “wavy” from the front the panel is straight and flat on the inside. It makes sense once you install it. Don’t freak out because they are slimmer than your panels you are attaching them to. I looped 3 loops on the hook instead of just one. I also pinched the hooks almost closed so the loop is less likely to fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Cherith Harkness

customer_reviews.title: Good for retrofitting curtains
customer_reviews.text: This did a good job of blocking the light and is fairly simple to install once you get the hang of it. The curtains include sharp books which allow you to attach these to the back of your existing curtains without the need for any additional holes in your walls. However the size is very awkward. I have average size windows but even using two pieces per window, I still have little gaps where the sun can come through. In the places where the curtain blocks the light, it does seem to block the light fully.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and the little loops are spaced close together making them very easy to attach
customer_reviews.text: No light comes through these. Very well made and the little loops are spaced close together making them very easy to attach. Just what I needed to block some very strong afternoon sun in my bedroom. I never open the draperies on this window anyway so instead of attaching the panels to the drapery rod, I chose to attach these panels directly to the wall to cover my window. I hooked the loops over pushpins that I stuck into the drywall. It made the panels sit close to the wall and prevents light from leaking around the edges. Perfect for what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Willi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for blackout
customer_reviews.text: These liners are amazing. I have dark gray blackout curtains in my bedroom and they don't even block light as much as these. I use them behind white tablecloths (trick I learned on Pinterest instead of buying expensive curtains). The only issue I had was I misread the description and thought one panel was 54" wide and it turns out each panel is 27" so I just need to sew them together or somehow connect them so you don't see the gap
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Blocks light really well, but are narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Blocks out the light really well. really like these and have bought them for all our drapes in 3 rooms. They are narrow though. you basically need 1 set/order for one side of a window. You then ned to sew or pin the two panels together so the light doesn't come through where they meet, but that was easy enough to do by hand and now they are perfect. One star off because they are no narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Nat W

customer_reviews.title: 2 panels fit 1 curtain panel
customer_reviews.text: They do work good, I don't like the way you connect it to the curtain I will end up sewing them to my curtains. Just be aware I thought I was getting a super deal with the packaging saying it was 2 panels vs. 1 panel. Yes there are 2 panels but those 2 panels only fit 1 standard curtain panel. So the value wasn't as great as I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Chau

customer_reviews.title: I bought them for my spare bedroom that feels like a sauna in the summer
customer_reviews.text: I have a standard window and I have one panel being each curtain. I must say they are a bit short width wise but i centered it and it blocks out the majority of the light. It really has helped make the room so much more fresher. I bought them for my spare bedroom that feels like a sauna in the summer. It feels so much better in there now. I also purchased the 50 chain shower curtain hooks and used those to hang them in between my grommet curtains. I did not want to use the hooks that came with them and risk tearing my curtains. 4-Stars: Due to the width
customer_reviews.author: Yannette

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install, but work well.
customer_reviews.text: When you are able to get them attached, they work great. My problem was getting them attached to my other curtains so that they were in the right place and did not pull down in the wrong spots. The panels come with little metal pieces that go through loops in the blackout panels and hook to the curtains you already have up. This turned out to be a much more complicated process than what I expected or wanted to deal with. That being said, they do work well once they are in place. I've noticed a huge difference in how cool my rooms stay and the rooms stay darker in the mornings.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebird80

customer_reviews.title: Blackout curtain liners
customer_reviews.text: Have bought these multiple times. Had to buy again because I moved and the blackout drapes I bought for my bedroom didn’t work well. These provided the added blackout darkness and noise reduction I needed for my bedroom. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Same Old Same Old

customer_reviews.title: Narrow!
customer_reviews.text: I know it has the dimensions right in the description, but I thought 2 would cover a whole, standard window. Nope. There are gaps. I’m going to have to get a total of 4 and install them overlapping to get the coverage I want. I may just go with some blackout curtains with the built in liners. Oh, also, they fime off the hooks very easily. I’m super tired of having to be extra cautious when opening my blonds do year things don’t fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Laura O.

customer_reviews.title: Hooks not safe for kids room-so sharp
customer_reviews.text: I really didn’t care for these. I was trying to cheap out by adding these to the back of my sons curtains. The hooks to attach to your other curtain make me sooo nervous. They are super sharp and look like they could fall off so easily. I can picture a kid putting one of these hooks in their mouth. They are very narrow too. Great idea, executed poorly
customer_reviews.author: Adam/Christina Felaccio

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: When I rearranged my room I realized that my computer desk was now facing the morning sun which made it painful if not impossible to do computer work in the morning. These blackout curtains help, but because I'm opening and closing them daily, they have a tendency to not stay on my sheers. I probably should have a heavier curtain to hook on the blackout curtains.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Mckay

customer_reviews.title: This one really works
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other room darkening curtain drapery , this one actually works !!! In the morning when the sun is bright outside, this one really does make the room dark. No light comes through this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P

customer_reviews.title: Cuts down on A/C bill
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased four sets from a local Wal-Mart at $24.99 a set. I wanted to cover the windows in the rest of the house, but at that price I couldn't do them all at once. So I searched on Amazon and found them about $8 less expensive per set. Needless to say, I have all the windows covered and it cuts down on having to use my AC constantly and a lower electric bill. The only difference between the two is that the ones in Wal-Mart have Velcro on each panel so you can secure them in the middle without light filtering through any gaps. It doesn't make any difference for me, but the price certainly does!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Walker

customer_reviews.title: Cool Energy Saver
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for the sunny west facing window. Our room is cooler and we are saving energy cooling the house. Hooks included made for quick easy install on the back of our cloth curtains.
customer_reviews.author: V Utx

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for double traverse rod installations.
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for double traverse rod installations. Excellent option for double traverse rod installations with the 80" blackout curtains installed with 84" curtains. To increase the sound effectiveness increase the number of blackout curtains. The loops connect well to traverse clips. The Velcro between each curtain adds to the function of the curtains both to block light and noise. The better curtains are not the curtains sold by the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H

customer_reviews.title: Just buy curtains that are already made to block out light
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why these panels are not wider. They work, but I had order 2 packages (4 panels total) to cover just 2 windows (and these are standard windows, not huge). The clip things are annoying and don't hold the straps attached to the panels very well. They look pretty terrible but keep the light out for the most part -- except the parts that are falling off the hooks. They also hang below my curtains. I plan to cut them off.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Girl

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my slider.
customer_reviews.text: I think these would work well for heavier curtains , which probably are less likely to need these, or windows where the treatments aren’t drawn daily. I have what I would consider standard thickness curtains on my bedroom slider and already two loops had fallen off the hooks when I tied them back. Also it appears the hooks would damage the curtains in a few weeks from movement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: These work better than the reviews state. Honestly, they are worth the price and even under the sheer curtains, they block out the sun just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie BS

customer_reviews.title: You need these
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extra thermal layer to keep the furnace that is the sun and other reflectors from roasting my front rooms. They lay flat in front of my blackout curtains and have dramatically lowered the heat from the window. I hung them separately but they are designed to hook into pocket or tab top curtains. Hang separately for grommet style
customer_reviews.author: juneyjoe

customer_reviews.title: These were very easy to attach and help to block out light
customer_reviews.text: These were very easy to attach and help to block out light. I noticed the measurements were a bit smaller than my panels, but thought that was because they were meant to line the back, but found that they don't line it to the edges like I expected and it creates an unfinished cheap look when the sun shines through. its a quick fix though, next time I might spend more time finding a curtain that is made to be a black out instead.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but sizing off
customer_reviews.text: The idea is there but the sizing is off. I have single panel curtains on my windows and these do not cover the entire panel. They do block the light where they are covering but the ends are not covered at all. See my photos for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi and Jay

customer_reviews.title: It is 77" only not 80".
customer_reviews.text: I measured it after trying it on and found it is only 77", not 80" as it claimed. Or, it might have meant it could fit an existing curtain in the length of 80". I needed 84" and thought 80" would not be too far from that. When I put it on, I realized a big gap at the bottom more than what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: I found the perfect curtains for my bedroom but they were not blackout
customer_reviews.text: I found the perfect curtains for my bedroom but they were not blackout, So I then found these, just ironed them and attached them to the backs of my curtains, had to get 2 pkg's of these because my panel was 54" and these are only 27". Anyway I over lapped the 2 in the middle of the curtain and stapled them together so light would not come through the middle of them on each panel of curtain. I love them, they are perfect, no light coming through.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cha

customer_reviews.title: Definitely makes the room darker
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this item a mediocre review because it does the job however my second order (needed an additional pair for the width of my curtains) never came with the hooks. I had something else on hand that was a stand-in which was easier than dealing with getting 14 hooks from the seller. But they d work.
customer_reviews.author: M. P. Van Overbeek

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: Although these blackout panels are well constructed and serve their function, they are cut extremely narrow. For use on a standard curtain, you will need 1 package per curtain panel. So plan to purchase 2 packages to completely line the back of a two-panel curtain per window. Hope that was clear. I ended up returning my purchase because I didn't think the investment was worth it for my use. Make sure to take into consideration the width of each of your curtain panels, as each package comes with a total of 54-inches wide of fabric - NOT two 54-inch wide panels.
customer_reviews.author: Shoozies

customer_reviews.title: Worth every $$
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up and it blocks light and the draft coming from the Windows in my bedroom and my kids bedroom. I ordered 5 of them and loved it so much I bought 3 more for my livingroom. Update: I received the 3 I ordered and put in my living room and in my daughters room and she noticed the difference in temperature in the livingroom and in her room and especially how dark her room is at night. She can sleep better now that our neighbors motion light is blocked.
customer_reviews.author: Semper Fi, NY

customer_reviews.title: but my only complaint is that they are not as wide as the curtains so they don't have great coverage. I should have bought 2 per
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go behind light pink nursery curtains for my younger daughter's room. They do the job well, but my only complaint is that they are not as wide as the curtains so they don't have great coverage. I should have bought 2 per curtain panel but that would have made the liner wider than the curtain. Great liner but awkward size.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Williams

customer_reviews.title: Work well over the 27" on each side
customer_reviews.text: These work if your windows and existing curtains are narrow---pay attention to the width. I only looked at the length. My curtains are the standard 44" equaling 88" wide curtains when closed. Since these only cover 27" each, which is 54" closed, there is light that comes in through each side. They are completely light blocking where the curtain does cover.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Why didnt I get these sooner? IN LOVE
customer_reviews.text: The install is a breeze! 5 minutes for 2 panels! Holy cow what an amazing difference they make :) my daughters room always gets morning sun and her curtains were originally room darkening but you never would of know! Maybe now she will sleep better!! LOVE THESE, WILL BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Had my doubts
customer_reviews.text: I bought these with little expectations. They have far surpassed and made our son's room much cooler and darker. They are intended to only cover the window and are actually not as wide as the whole curtain itself, but it still works out. They are very easy to hook to the existing curtain and have served their purpose without us having to get new curtains, which I did not want to do.
customer_reviews.author: S. Langan

customer_reviews.title: Work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I thought that the loops were so flimsy for the weight that they wouldn't work, but they do. There is only velcro on one side and I needed three panels for a siding glass door, but that is unusual so it makes sense they have velcro on only one side. The velcro helps hold two panels together so there aren't any air leaks. These were a good deal so I bought 4 pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Tutor

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Product is misleading in that it states that you are getting a pair (meaning two!) of panels that are 54” wide. Instead you get 4 total panels, that are 27” w each. Light streaks in through panels since they are not attached, thus defeating the purpose of blackout. I realize shipping times are delayed due to current times, but the facility that they left from is about 30 minutes from my home and it took a week to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Engelhardt

customer_reviews.title: Chemical smell.
customer_reviews.text: Smelled it right out of package . Let it air out outside for days and seemed ok. Then brought in and hung up. Seems soon as sun hits it the smell emits again. Daughter started getting headaches so took it down.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of the size!
customer_reviews.text: I received these blackout panels and was excited to install them only to find that the width they are advertising is not the width of each panel but the total width of the combined panels. They are super skinny! Please be aware that it takes two panels just to cover one standard panel of curtains. I like the quality enough that I came back to amazon and purchased another pair, but my install has been put off until the second pair come in. It will also require me to sew the two skinny panels together in order to get the full blocking of light on each panel that I am looking to get.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Demetral

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I get these sooner?
customer_reviews.text: These panels are wonderful! I don't know why I didn't get them years ago. Most of our windows are west-facing so we get a barrage of afternoon sunlight in the summer. This is great by makes for a really hot house! These panels have reduced the heat in our house by at least 15 degrees and make it so comfortable! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my daughters room to block out the morning sun. She has a double curtain rod so I just hung them behind her white curtains on a separate rod and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L.

customer_reviews.title: Great option for SMALLER than average curtain panels
customer_reviews.text: Be careful before you buy. READ very CAREFULLY the dimensions of this. One package of these will fit a standard curtain panel. So you will need to by 2 x 2 packs of these to fit across your typical window. These little panels do velcro together so technically you could affix two to one of your panels and get the effect you are wanting. I made custom curtains that are about half a standard panel so these work perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: LD0708

customer_reviews.title: I placed it behind my 95" curtains and am very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand all the complaints on this product. Everything I needed to know about it before ordering it was available in the description. I ordered the 92 inch version. It also came with hanging hooks. I placed it behind my 95" curtains and am very pleased with it. Although my curtains are not quite as wide as the these (about 25" width) I was able to fold them on one side and pin it to make it fit. I only ordered the one set to check them for quality and satisfaction that they did what they said. I am going to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best blackout
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Added them to the back of sheer curtains I already had to make them blackout. Super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly!! Definitely cancels out the light. We have black out shades and these curtains help keep out the light that comes through the cracks. Order more than 1 panel for each side. Had to end up sewing two together for each side and we have a small window.
customer_reviews.author: Jam33165

customer_reviews.title: Blocks out >99% of light
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 54 x 80 size, which come as (2) 27 x 80 curtains to make the 54 x 80 dimension. They do block out >99% of the light. They can be installed two ways. One way is to slide them through a curtain rod by using the fold at the top of the curtain. The other is to use the metal clips that come with them. Both are useful, depending on your certain rod configuration. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great at blocking light
customer_reviews.text: These blackout panels are amazing at blocking out the light from the large, west-facing window in my bedroom. In the evenings, the room would be so bright you almost couldn't stand it, but with these panels, it's dark and cozy. They also block out the street lights at night. I love that these attach to the back of my existing drapes so that I didn't have to change out the drapes that match my decor in order to block the light. I'm very pleased with these panels.
customer_reviews.author: RLM

customer_reviews.title: Blocks the sun well
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize this is two panels. Thought it was one panel. I am using these to block a window permanently not to put behind curtains. They are push pinned to the wall. Would have been better if it had been one wide panel but works ok this way. May go to the fabric store and buy a single panel.
customer_reviews.author: G. Morse

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these..
customer_reviews.text: Check the dimensions of the actual product first. It says it’s for larger curtains, but that’s only if the curtains are bunched up. Poorly designed product. Almost ruined my curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Z

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, does not let in any light
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, does not let in any light, using in my bedroom, I can’t stand having a peep of light coming in and this worked like a charm, comes 2 in a package which was perfect, I live in a mobile home so one panel worked for each side windows, then the other set worked for the wider window.
customer_reviews.author: irma camp

customer_reviews.title: These black out our room, had to use 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: These black out our room, had to use 2 panels per window and there is always a little gap. I will be using Velcro to solve that problem. They are heavy so it also helps with temperature, keeps the suns heat out in the summer and keeps the cold out in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous deal on blackout panels!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviews that the listing for this items is misleading, but the small print explains each panel is only 27" wide. However, the size was perfect for my needs. I needed three sets for two windows (one large, one small) and the cost for all three was less than for one panel from another retailer. Also, the panels are TRUE blackout panels! They panels even come with hooks which I didn't catch in the description, so I ordered a pcak I don't need.
customer_reviews.author: ATLshopper

customer_reviews.title: They do a great job with darkening but I wish they were a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter's nursery. They do a great job with darkening but I wish they were a little wider. My daughter's bedroom window is 46 1/2 inches wide and these just seem a little too narrow. They cover the window but without enough overlap on the ends so that light still shines through. If I wasn't already using room darkening shades, these would not have worked as I needed. However, they are still a great product! No strange smell (as I've seen some people comment). I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: BBJ

customer_reviews.title: however the hanging mechanism is very poor. When the curtain is moved
customer_reviews.text: The blackout function works well, however the hanging mechanism is very poor. When the curtain is moved, the liner becomes unhooked, and no longer performs the blackout function because it is no longer in place. The liner needs to be sewn to the curtain to work effectively. I am disappointed, since I purchased the item because sewing was not required. There is also the option to hanging the liner directly to a curtain rod; my set up doesn't allow for that, so it isn't an option for me.
customer_reviews.author: David Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Curtain Liners
customer_reviews.text: I’m really glad I bought these. I loved my white curtains, but they just let too much light in. These liners were the perfect solution. They did have some random stains, a light odd chemical smell, and very chintzy yarn loops to hold them up, but still very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laura H.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Works
customer_reviews.text: These curtains truly block light completely and were easy to place on the back of our curtains. Great value and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: CELake

customer_reviews.title: Attach to any existing curtain, true blackout
customer_reviews.text: Please note that this product contains two panels per package. They offer a true blackout experience and let 0% light through. I really like the architecture of the clips so they can be added to any style of existing hanging curtain. It was tough to find something like this but really happy with the quality and easy of installation.
customer_reviews.author: ak04

customer_reviews.title: they are not tight enough and slip out so easily. It would take a lot of work to ...
customer_reviews.text: The hooking system with the thread just didn't work out at all, they are not tight enough and slip out so easily. It would take a lot of work to make these fit and I am still worried considering I have a young child in the house. I ended up taking off my normal curtains and just putting it through the fabric opening at the top which sort of defeats the purpose. The sizing is just weird for most windows.
customer_reviews.author: CrysD724

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective Light Blocking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go behind my daughter's sheer curtains. She cannot handle light in her room while she is trying to sleep, and she LOVES how dark her room gets with these blackout panels. This is a great step up from the tacky dark sheet she had hanging from her curtain rod! The white panels are nearly imperceptible under the sheers, and I am thrilled that the room looks classy again! These panels easily tie back to let in the light during the day. The price was great, and the product is quite satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Young Shopper 123

customer_reviews.title: good at blocking light but some flaws
customer_reviews.text: These block out light well but we've had trouble with a couple of them falling off over time. They are narrow but if you have several, they did a good job of making my curtains block out more light. They are somewhat hard to attach and I had to put holes through the back of some curtains to attach. We have them in 2 bedrooms. They also make the curtains heavier on the rod which may be a problem for flimsy rods. For the price and since we already had curtains we liked, they were worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Johnston

customer_reviews.title: The hooks used to secure the panel to the curtain are very sharp and easy to place
customer_reviews.text: These panels are effective at blocking light. The width of the panel is HALF the size of a standard window curtain; use 2. The hooks used to secure the panel to the curtain are very sharp and easy to place, but the loops used to hang the panel on the hooks aren't totally secure. They slip off easily, especially at the edges, when you move the curtain. I plan on sewing the panels to my curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Can be a little difficult to get the right placement ...
customer_reviews.text: Can be a little difficult to get the right placement when adding the hooks to the curtains, but overall, they block out a LOT of light and help keep my apartment a little cooler in the afternoon sun. That's a BIG plus in Florida when the afternoon sun beats down in the windows in the living room and dining room. They can also be cut to fit if the width is too big or you need to split one of the panels in half.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job! But buy two!
customer_reviews.text: This worked out PERFECT. But heads up I have a standard size window nothing special and one pack with two liners will only work well on ONE panel of curtain. So buy two so you can do both panels because these are very narrow. But over all the liners do just what I want them to do. I posted a picture showing the difference and I got like a tanish type curtains. The hooks that came with it seem to work great with my curtains so over all I'm very happy and will be getting these liners for all the rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These curtains are great at blocking out light
customer_reviews.text: These curtains are great at blocking out light. However, if your curtains are very lightweight, the hook method of attaching them will not work. They were constantly falling out anytime you moved the curtains. I ended up sewing the blackout panels directly to the curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Blocks sunlight, and lets me sleep during the day; blocks parking light at night
customer_reviews.text: Very cost effective solution that added a huge amount of light blocking to my curtains. Keeps my room several degrees cooler during the day. I have a large south facing window which lets in a lot of light. These were a godsend to my sanity and my comfort.
customer_reviews.author: David Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good thermaliners
customer_reviews.text: As blackout panels these liners work great. They also do a good job of blocking heat and cold. They are difficult to de-wrinkle. I tried a low setting dryer tumble that did not work at all. A low iron setting did a minimal job. Perhaps over time they will lose the wrinkles from the packaging but so far it hasn't happened (1 1/2 months later). I am going to try washing and hanging damp to see if that does it. Aside from this irritation they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: C-Dub

customer_reviews.title: Block light but width is too short
customer_reviews.text: These do pretty well at blocking out the light. However, the width makes no sense. I actually got these to put behind yellow eclipse curtains that did a terrible job at blocking out light. So, they were the same brand curtains I was putting them up against with very different widths. See the attached photo with the thermaliner laying on top of my curtain. I honestly think I would have been better off buying another set of the yellow eclipse curtains and just double up hanging them. Save yourself some trouble and use curtain clip rings to hang the curtains. I just clipped the curtains on and didn't have to even mess with the hooks they give you.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley P.

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: As previous reviews said, these don't quite cover the entire window. So look into buying two packs if 100% coverage is wanted. They do indeed block out light well and also keep my baby's room cool(er) in the AZ summer. Overall happy with the purchase. Would be 5 star if each panel were just a few inches wider.
customer_reviews.author: Kaz

customer_reviews.title: Linings are not better than blackout curtains
customer_reviews.text: Read the description carefully. These are two 25" liners. They work OK, but I had to buy two sets, and the gap in between the curtains lets light through. My goal was to save money by using the blackout liners with regular curtains, but since I had to buy two sets it didn't turn out to be a better value. I would have been happier purchasing good blackout curtains and saving the trouble and expense of using these.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: This was a pain to put on the curtains and ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain to put on the curtains and they dont stay on very well. They also aren't as big as the curtains so you may need to buy more.I was just expecting more for the price. They do seem to do their job though.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hales

customer_reviews.title: Not accurately sized
customer_reviews.text: So small! These are supposed to be 54” wide and the drapes I put them on are only 50” and they don’t cover all the way. They are about 4 inches too short. They are also heavy adding a lot of weight to the curtain rod.
customer_reviews.author: Twin Mama

customer_reviews.title: This really works real well..
customer_reviews.text: We live in Indian Wells Valley, Ca.. It gets real hot, and the last few years , real humid often during the summer.. So, we needed blackout panels for our curtains.. These were great.. Part of keeping your home cooled down is to keep out the blazing hot sun rays.. Good Insulation also is a must.. And dual pane tinted windows.. So, if you have the same needs as we do.. These are for you.. It takes 2 people to install these, by the way..
customer_reviews.author: K. Baer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size listed
customer_reviews.text: Description says 54x80 but the width is, maximum, half that.. doesn’t work.. and they took forever to get here
customer_reviews.author: Sjvm

customer_reviews.title: These are nice and do the job
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and do the job, I have noticed they like to pop off the hooks but that's always and easy fix. Make sure you do measure the width of your windows as these do seem to be half the width of most normal curtains.
customer_reviews.author: E. Anaid

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Right side does not have the shades on them and left side does. Wish they were longer but work really well for the money! Not sure how well they keep heat out yet but impressed with how much they block the sun. Easy to install as well.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Paul

customer_reviews.title: great idea
customer_reviews.text: i am so sick of messing around trying to find nice blackout/thermal curtains this allows you to do this to any of your curtains it is easy to use and works better than many other curtains claiming to be blackouts ive tried in the past. it arrived in the time promised and in great condition and i didnt notice any weird smell like i have seen similar items reviews complain about. happy with this purchase and now i can have whatever curtains i want to be blackouts.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: this was the PERFECT fix. These were for my new born daughters ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought what I thought were blackout curtains and they let all sorts of light in. Obviously I couldn't return them. this was the PERFECT fix. These were for my new born daughters room. it is pitch dark at all hours!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Blackout liner for my current blackout curtains.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put on the inside of my current blackout curtains that don't block out enough light. NOTE THE WIDTH OF THESE! I did not read/measure and had to buy two sets. They are easy instal and block out excess light. Love them and my dark room. They will be perfect for when I have to work nights. I cannot comment on how well they would work if they were placed on the inside of normal, non blackout curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Allison H

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Kept the room dark so I could get some sleep during the day. Very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Label
customer_reviews.text: If you didn't read the other reviews, this is 2pcs 27" wide by 80" long for a TOTAL of 54" wide. I knew this going into the purchase and ordered the right number. The product doesn't have any kind of odor and works great at blocking the sun. But the deceptive labeling just annoys the tar out of me. I don't understand why the entire blackout liner industry is set on misleading consumers. Product: 5 stars Labeling: 0 stars
customer_reviews.author: Absolver

customer_reviews.title: Huge return postage cost!
customer_reviews.text: Narrow, stiff panels are difficult to attach and change the way the drape “hangs”. They want you to gather the drape and then attach these panels which barely cover the window and gap. If you return them you get socked with a BIG mailing expense. BE WARY
customer_reviews.author: S.McNee

customer_reviews.title: Extremely bad chemical fumes that washing doesn't take out. ..
customer_reviews.text: Do well at blocking out light, but beware the fumes. I have washed and line dried twice now, and they still have a very strong chemical odor that I can't seem to get out. They make the whole room smell bad. I am very disappointed. I'm not sure I can continue to use these, as they were for the nursery and I don't want to expose or kids to the fumes.
customer_reviews.author: Katydid

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: I put it in front of the room darkening curtains I have and it helped darken the room but it's definitely not noise cancelling. It seems to keep the room cooler. I would buy something thicker and with a better quality instead of this curtain.
customer_reviews.author: Ale

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I needed complete blackout curtains for my sliding doors! We have 6+ hours of direct sunlight on our door in the afternoon the hottest part of the day. Our slidding doors are even tinted and the air conditioner could not keep up. I loved my curtains and hated to change them out.. this was the perfect fix without spending $100 on new curtains and I can take the panels off in the winter when we don't need them! I'll be buying a set for my daughters room!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love these room darkening liners. They are easy to hook onto the existing curtains. I moved to a new place and needed a few more for additional windows to cover, aomI ordered a couple more sets
customer_reviews.author: Toolgirl

customer_reviews.title: Keeps coming off hook
customer_reviews.text: In retrospect, I think I should have just bought blackout curtains instead of sheer curtains and then adding this back lining to it. It works fine when they stay on my curtains but they often come off of the hook, it’s really annoying to keep having to put them back on. Plus the width is too narrow, I had to use two of these backlining things to fit one of my curtains, awkward sizing!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to details. 2 slim panels. Not two wide panels.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda of annoyed because the description is misleading unless you read all the way to the bottom. My fault for thinking both panels were 54 inches. Instead it’s 2, 27 inch panels. Feeling kind of screwed for ordering these when I could have found a dif brand at the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Great! Just what I needed and perfect price. Panel is not as wide as my curtain but I ruff then together and it works. Went from light in room to dark. Left panel is without blackout. My middle curtain are already blackout curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Rosy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, ineffective
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. We bought them for our nursery and they are ineffective. You need multiple panels to cover any window you'd want blacked out leaving gaps in the coverage, they're plastic and cheaply made so they don't lay flat against the window also letting in light and they make noise when you move them. Don't buy these- just replace your curtains with proper blackout curtains
customer_reviews.author: Rachel VM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are working well for the windows in the condo we are leasing. Block the light well. They come with drapery hooks to attach to your curtains, but they have about a 3" rod pocket and I bought shower curtain tension rods to hang them on inside the 4" window casings of our windows. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: cheriwinkle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price for an awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: These curtains are great. They help keep prevent the cold from seeping through our old windows and definitely darken things up in both my room and my baby's room. Don't buy them as a decorative statement though! They definitely look boring by themselves!
customer_reviews.author: Rylee T.

product_meta.title: Eclipse Solid Drapery Hooks Included for Easy Attachment, Double Panel, 54x92, White
product_meta.description: No need to part with your existing curtains. Attach the eclipse blackout Thermaliner to any curtain to experience the darkness, silence and beauty of Eclipse curtains. Quickly and easily transform traditional window treatments into curtains that provide light blocking and noise reducing benefits. The eclipse Thermaliner panel has been laboratory-tested to help block over 99% of intrusive light, unwanted noise, and can help save on home heating and cooling costs. National Sleep Foundation studies show that reduced light and noise are optimal for a better night’s sleep. Eclipse thermaliners are perfect for the bedroom, kid’s room or nursery, providing the ideal sleep environment for the whole family. Easy to use hooks provide a simple hanging solution. Hooks included. Rod pocket hanging option fits up to a 1.5” curtain rod. Rod sold separately. Hanging instructions included. Each Thermaliner panel measures 27” wide to fit panels up to 54” wide. Available in your choice of 60”, 80” and 92” lengths. Each package contains two 27” panels. 100% Polyester. Easy care, machine washable, tumble dry, do not bleach. Imported.
feature_bullets: LIGHT BLOCKING – Eclipse Thermaliner panels paired with your existing curtains block over 99% of outside light and harmful UV rays to ensure upmost privacy, protection, and helps reduce furniture fading. Perfect for living room, bedroom, or kid’s room

SIZE – Enhance your living space with Blackout Thermaliner panels with each panel measuring 27” wide, and each package contains two 27” wide panels. The perfect combination between Modern style and high functionality

ENERGY EFFICIENT – Thermaliner panels have been laboratory-tested and designed to block out intrusive sunlight, reduce unwanted noise, and can help to save on home heating and cooling costs. Provides an insulated barrier against summer heat and winter chill

EASY SET UP – Blackout liners are versatile and can be attached to any window curtain using easy-to-use hooks that are included; or hung from a separate rod. Rod pocket fits up to a 1.5” diameter rod (Rod not included)
CARE INSTRUCTIONS - Machine washable 100% polyester in gentle cycle and cold water. Do not bleach. Warm iron and tumble dry at low temperatures
Easy attaches to your existing curtain panel with drapery hooks included
Blocks light for a better night's sleep, at home movie viewing and daytime sleeping
Reduces unwanted noise and helps to save on home heating and cooling costs
100% Polyester; machine wash, tumble dry, do not bleach; imported
Each Thermaliner panel measures 27” wide to fit panels up to 54” wide.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars161 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
